item.title: How the !gabbaken-!gabbaken (the Mason Wasp) punished his wife for making personal remarks
item.summary: The Mason Wasp (? Genus Lyrops) who shot his wife for making a personal remark. By /han≠kass’o (L VIII.-12. 7098-7103). The Mason Wasp shoots his wife with an arrow intended for the Hare, then cries regretfully when he sees that she is dead.
item.comments: 1) p.7097v: |han≠kass'o heard this story from his mother (|xabbi-an) who probably heard it from her mother (≠kammi); about the mason wasp, 2) p.7099v: see Hunting hare, 3) This story is found in Book VIII-12
item.author: |han≠kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
